text: The 2003 LPGA Championship was the 49th LPGA Championship, played June 5–8 at DuPont Country Club in Wilmington, Delaware. Annika Sörenstam won in a playoff over Grace Park with a par on the first sudden death hole. It was the first of three consecutive LPGA Championships for Sorenstam and the fifth of her ten major titles. Two weeks earlier, Sörenstam played in a PGA Tour event, the Colonial in Fort Worth, Texas. The DuPont Country Club hosted this championship for eleven consecutive seasons, from 1994 through 2004. ==Past champions in the field== ===Made the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || R3 || R4 || Total || To par || Finish |- | align=left|Beth Daniel || align=left| || 1990 || 71 || 71 || 70 || 72 || 284 || E || T3 |- | align=left|Meg Mallon || align=left| || 1991 || 74 || 69 || 70 || 75 || 288 || +4 || T27 |- | align=left|Juli Inkster || align=left| || 1999, 2000 || 71 || 72 || 71 || 77 || 291 || +7 || T37 |- | align=left|Jan Stephenson || align=left| || 1982 || 74 || 72 || 69 || 76 || 291 || +7 || T37 |- | align=left|Se Ri Pak || align=left| || 1998, 2002 || 72 || 74 || 72 || 76 || 294 || +10 || T46 |- | align=left|Karrie Webb || align=left| || 2001 || 72 || 72 || 78 || 75 || 297 || +13 || T56 |- |} Source: ===Missed the cut=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Player || Country || Year(s) won || R1 || R2 || Total || To par |- | align=left|Laura Davies || align=left| || 1994, 1996 || 75 || 74 || 149 || +7 |- | align=left|Kelly Robbins || align=left| || 1995 || 74 || 76 || 150 || +8 |- | align=left|Christa Johnson || align=left| || 1997 || 78 || 73 || 151 || +9 |- | align=left|Betsy King || align=left| || 1992 || 76 || 75 || 151 || +9 |- | align=left|Sherri Turner || align=left| || 1988 || 80 || 74 || 154 || +12 |- | align=left|Sally Little || align=left| || 1980 || 71 || 85 || 156 || +14 |- | align=left|Nancy Lopez || align=left| || 1978, 1985, 1989 || 77 || 79 || 156 || +14 |- | align=left|Jane Geddes || align=left| || 1987 || 83 || WD || colspan=2| |- | align=left|Pat Bradley || align=left| || 1986 || DQ || colspan=3| |} Source: ==Final leaderboard== Sunday, June 8, 2003 {|class="wikitable" !
